screen_design_ref: Figure 39.1: Introduction Page Load and Navigation
description: Verify that the Blue Team vs Red Team introduction page loads correctly with all content sections
scenario: User navigates to Blue vs Red Team mode introduction page to learn about the simulation
expected_results: Introduction page displays with hero section, team comparison, scenario overview, and navigation buttons
procedure:
1. Log in as authenticated user
2. Navigate to /blue-vs-red/
3. Verify page loads with gradient background and cyber grid
4. Check hero section displays title and description
5. Confirm 'Start Simulation' and 'Tutorial' buttons are present
6. Verify team comparison cards are displayed
7. Check floating orbs animation is active

screen_design_ref: Figure 39.30: Complete Blue vs Red Team Workflow
description: Verify complete end-to-end workflow from introduction through simulation completion with comprehensive cybersecurity training
scenario: User experiences complete Blue Team vs Red Team training from introduction to advanced simulation mastery
expected_results: Complete workflow provides engaging cybersecurity education covering defensive strategies, incident response, and real-time threat analysis
procedure:
1. Access Blue Team vs Red Team introduction page
2. Review team comparison and scenario overview
3. Navigate through comprehensive tutorial covering defensive concepts
4. Launch main simulation dashboard with all components
5. Experience AI-driven attacks using Q-Learning adaptive system
6. Use Defense Command Terminal for incident response
7. Monitor Network Defense Map for asset status visualization
8. Respond to real-time alerts in Alert Center
9. Manage security controls (firewall, endpoint, access control)
10. Utilize AI Threat Analysis for attack pattern recognition
11. Execute incident response procedures for security events
12. Practice terminal commands for defensive operations (status, scan, block, isolate)
13. Experience adaptive learning difficulty adjustments based on performance
14. Monitor 15-minute simulation timer and performance metrics
15. Receive real-time feedback on defensive decisions
16. Complete simulation with comprehensive scoring and performance analysis
17. Review final results including asset integrity, detection rate, and response effectiveness
18. Access performance recommendations for skill improvement
19. Experience session persistence and state recovery capabilities
20. Verify educational feedback enhances cybersecurity knowledge
21. Complete multiple sessions to experience AI learning adaptation
22. Verify comprehensive skill development in Blue Team defense, incident response, threat analysis, and real-time cybersecurity operations essential for SOC analyst and cybersecurity professional roles

description: Verify security measures protect against client-side vulnerabilities and data exposure
scenario: Simulation implements proper security controls to protect user data and prevent exploitation
expected_results: Security controls prevent XSS, CSRF, and unauthorized data access
procedure:
1. Test input validation in terminal commands
2. Verify XSS protection in alert messages
3. Check CSRF protection on API endpoints
4. Test authorization for game state access
5. Verify secure session management
6. Check for data exposure in browser tools
7. Test API rate limiting and abuse prevention

description: Verify interactive elements and animations work correctly on the introduction page
scenario: User interacts with various elements on the introduction page to explore features
expected_results: Hover effects, animations, and button interactions work smoothly with visual feedback
procedure:
1. Load introduction page
2. Hover over feature cards and verify hover effects
3. Test keyboard navigation with Enter key
4. Verify gradient shift animation is running
5. Check floating orbs animation cycles properly
6. Test button hover states and transitions
7. Verify notification system displays feedback messages

description: Verify AI system dynamically adjusts difficulty within a single session
scenario: AI Engine adapts attack intensity and tactics based on real-time player performance during the Blue Team vs Red Team simulation
expected_results: AI increases or decreases attack frequency and complexity in response to player performance, ensuring balanced challenge without external adaptive learning integration
procedure:
1. Initialize simulation with AI Engine
2. Start simulation and engage in defensive actions
3. Observe AI adapting attack frequency based on successful/failed defenses
4. Verify AI introduces more complex tactics when defenses are consistently effective
5. Confirm AI reduces pressure when defenses repeatedly fail
6. Ensure AI difficulty adjustments remain within acceptable challenge boundaries
7. Check AI adaptive behavior resets between new sessions (no carry-over learning)
